posts.post_content: @nammertime: This is bad even by old standards. 4/4 for 5cmc wasn't good, it was just the average. Each of the basic Elementals was still better than that, for example. What makes this card insulting is that not only is it two-color, but also a legend. So that's two drawbacks with no benefit to outweigh. Compare this to [Gwendlyn Di Corci](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gwendlyn Di Corci), who costs one less mana, has the same total power/toughness, and comes with an awesome ability.
posts.html:
@nammertime: This is bad even by old standards. 4/4 for 5cmc wasn't good, it was just the average. Each of the basic Elementals was still better than that, for example. What makes this card insulting is that not only is it two-color, but also a legend. So that's two drawbacks with no benefit to outweigh. posts.post_content: Andrion's (alleged) advantage over [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) and [Water Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Water Elemental) appears to be that he could take advantage of [Cathedral of Serra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathedral of Serra) and [Seafarer's Quay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seafarer's Quay). As I mentioned on that land cycle, the original intent was likely that you would include those lands as a matter of course, so your included legends could form an adventuring party of sorts. Problem? They over-estimated the efficacy of banding.
